document_data.name: Venom of Varae
document_data.mainbody: '''''Venom of Varae''''' was a [[divine magic]] spell given to followers of [[Sseth]] or his aspect known as [[Varae]]. It allowed the caster to spit [[snake]] venom at a target.
document_data.Effects:
This spell enabled the caster to hold actual snake venom in their mouth and spit it at a target up to {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}} away. The venom acted like a contact [[poison]] and was very difficult to resist, doing severe injury. Even if the victim managed to resist the poison, they still received a quarter of the poisonous damage. In either case, the onset of the effect took only six seconds.

The caster was immune to the effects of the venom and could hold it in their mouth as long as they did not swallow, speak, or otherwise open their mouth. If they did any of these things, the spell was negated.
document_data.Components: This spell required a [[Verbal component|verbal]] incantation prior to pouring a vial of snake venom (the [[material component]]) into their mouth and then expectorating it at a target (the [[somatic component]]). The spell also required the use of the priest's [[holy symbol]].
